data.partBlankContent: Last, but certainly not least, are the primates. Their nat____ habitat, with f__ exceptions, are t__ forests. Most li__ in t__ trees, with ha___ that gr___, go__ color vis___, a__ intelligence. In t__ Pliocene per___ some mo___ out on__ the sava_____ as gras_____ replaced for____. data.fullContent: Last, but certainly not least, are the primates. Their natural habitat, with few exceptions, are the forests. Most live in the trees, with hands that grasp, good color vision, and intelligence. In the Pliocene period some moved out onto the savannahs as grassland replaced forests. Mankind is the result of this shift into the savannahs.
data.answer: 最后，但肯定不是最不重要的，是灵长类动物。除了少数例外，它们的自然栖息地都是森林。大多数生活在树上，用手抓住，良好的色觉，和智慧。在上新世时期，由于草原取代了森林，一些动物迁移到大草原上。人类就是这一转变进入大草原的结果。
